Relation to AI: AI can identify poverty hotspots, optimize resource allocation, and track real-time progress through satellite data and predictive analytics.
Indicator: Population living below national poverty lines
Indicator name in OWiD: Share of population living below national poverty lines, 2022
Source: Multiple sources compiled by World Bank (2024)

Relation to AI: AI can predict food shortages, improve crop yields via precision agriculture, and guide distribution of nutritional support.
Indicator name in OWiD: Share of the population that is undernourished
Source: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (2023)

Relation to AI: AI-powered diagnostics and telemedicine can enhance early disease detection, reduce mortality, and improve healthcare delivery.
Source: Multiple sources compiled by World Bank (2024)

Relation to AI: AI-driven learning tools and personalized education platforms can improve access, retention, and educational outcomes.
Indicator name in OWiD: Completion rate, primary education, both sexes (%), CR.1

Relation to AI: AI can analyze gender gaps, detect bias in hiring or policy, and assist in evaluating the impact of political participation.
AI-based monitoring systems can optimize water quality management, leak detection, and resource planning.
Indicator: Access to safely managed drinking water
Indicator name in OWiD: Share of the population using safely managed drinking water services
Source: WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme for Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene (JMP)

Relation to AI: AI can improve grid management, forecast energy demand, and optimize renewable energy deployment.
Indicator name in OWiD: 7.2.1 - Renewable energy share in the total final energy consumption (%) - EG_FEC_RNEW
Source: International Energy Agency, International Renewable Energy Agency and United Nations Statistics Division

Relation to AI: AI-driven analytics can spur productivity, boost innovation, and generate inclusive economic strategies.
Indicator name in OWiD: Unemployment, total (% of total labor force) (modeled ILO estimate)
Source: Multiple sources compiled by World Bank (2024)

Relation to AI: AI research accelerates innovation, fosters new technologies, and catalyzes further investment in R&D.
Indicator name in OWiD: Research and development expenditure (% of GDP)
Source: Multiple sources compiled by World Bank (2024)

Relation to AI: AI tools can highlight disparities, model policy impacts, and enable data-driven decisions to reduce inequality.
Indicator name in OWiD: Income inequality (commonly the Gini index or the income share held by the poorest 40%)
Source: World Bank – processed by Our World in Data

Relation to AI: AI-driven urban planning and satellite imagery analysis can inform upgrades in housing and infrastructure.
Indicator: Proportion of urban population living in slums or informal settlements
Indicator name in OWiD: 11.1.1 - Proportion of urban population living in slums (%) - EN_LND_SLUM

Relation to AI: AI can optimize supply chains, minimize waste, and improve resource efficiency across production cycles.
Indicator: Material footprint per capita (or domestic material consumption)
Indicator name in OWiD: 12.2.2 - Domestic material consumption per capita, by type of raw material (tonnes) - EN_MAT_DOMCMPC - Total or no breakdown

Relation to AI: AI can forecast emissions, guide climate policy, and optimize energy systems for reduced carbon footprints.
Indicator: Deaths and missing persons due to natural disasters
Indicator name in OWiD: 13.1.1 - Number of deaths and missing persons attributed to disasters per 100,000 population (number) - VC_DSR_MTMP
Source: UN Office for Disaster Risk Reductio

Relation to AI: AI can analyze marine data, track illegal fishing, and help manage sustainable fishing practices.
Indicator name in OWiD: 14.6.1 - Progress by countries in the degree of implementation of international instruments aiming to combat illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing (level of implementation: 1 lowest to 5 highest) - ER_REG_UNFCIM
Source: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations

Relation to AI: AI-based remote sensing can detect deforestation, enhance reforestation efforts, and support biodiversity.
Indicator name in OWiD: 15.2.1 - Annual forest area change rate (%) - AG_LND_FRSTCHG
Source: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations

Relation to AI: AI can support crime analytics, predictive policing (with ethical considerations), and improved community safety measures.
Indicator name in OWiD: 16.2.2 - Detected victims of human trafficking, by age and sex (number) - VC_HTF_DETV - under 18 years old - Female
Source: UN Office on Drugs and Crime

Relation to AI: AI can track aid flows, predict areas of greatest need, and evaluate the effectiveness of development programs.
Indicator name in OWiD: Official Development Assistance (ODA) as a share of national income (GNI) from high-income countries
Source: United Nations Department of Economic and Social Affairs (2020)
